title: All Sony Xperia Z models to get Android 5.0 Lollipop starting February 2015 | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Sony Android
Lollipop](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Sony announced that[Android 5.0
Lollipop](https://www.trustedreviews.com/android-5-0-lollipop-review) will be
coming to the entire range of Xperia Z devices beginning in February 2015. **

Mike Fasulo, President and COO of Sony Electronics, made the announcement
during Sony’s press conference at CES 2015.

“We made great progress here in the United States market with our critically
acclaimed [Xperia Z3](https://www.trustedreviews.com/sony-xperia-z3-review)
and Xperia Z3v as well as the exciting new partnership with Verizon in
addition to our very strong relationship with T-Mobile and as you may have
heard both devices are part of our initiative to bring Android 5.0 Lollipop to
the entire Xperia Z series starting globally next month.”

Fasulo didn’t provide exact dates or the order that the Xperia Z3, [Xperia
Z2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/sony-xperia-z2-review) and Z1 will be
getting the Android update neither did he specifically mention any of the
Xperia Z range of tablets.

**Read more:** [CES 2015 – all the latest news and hands-ons  
](https://www.trustedreviews.com/hubs/ces-2015)  
Not only is Sony committed to bringing Android to it’s flagship range of
phones and tablets it’s also adding Android to it’s new range of smart TVs.
This gives Android phone and tablet users the ability to throw content from
their devices directly to their Sony TV without the need of a separate product
like the [Chromecast](https://www.trustedreviews.com/google-chromecast-review)
or [Roku Streaming Stick](https://www.trustedreviews.com/roku-streaming-stick-
review).
